summary: This document is a July 13, 2021 preparation memo for trial testimony, summarizing a detective's interview with a mother (referred to as 'El') about her son's ('U') potential connections to Jeffrey Epstein. It details the mother's recollections of her son's travel invitations, packages received, phone calls related to work in Palm Beach, and her realization years later that her son was likely abused by Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the abuse allegations. The mother ('El') states she did not realize her son ('U') had been sexually abused by Epstein until the FBI investigation in approximately 2007.

persons.name: Giselle Maxine
persons.context: A female caller with an accent who called multiple times regarding work in Palm Beach. Described as being particularly unpleasant in tone during one call.

connections.description: Mother and son. El is providing testimony about her son U's experiences and her own recollections.
According to the mother's deductions, U was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein, though this was not explicitly stated to her at the time.
Giselle Maxine was a caller to the household phone regarding work for U in Palm Beach, suggesting a logistical or employment connection.

events.title: FBI Investigation Contact
events.description: The FBI knocked on the door of El and U as part of an investigation, which led El to begin to realize U had been abused by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Son's Travel to Palm Beach
events.description: U was invited to travel to an island (likely Epstein's). El also recalls U may have gone to Palm Beach with someone, returning with pictures of gargoyles from the Palm Beach property.

events.title: Receipt of Suspicious Packages
events.description: U received packages which El did not see the contents of, but afterwards El remembers there being books about massage and promiscuous clothing in the house.

locations: An island (likely referring to Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: The mother ('El') did not realize her son ('U') had been sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein until the FBI knocked on their door around 2007 as part of an investigation.
U received packages, after which El noticed books about massage and promiscuous clothing in their home.
Multiple callers, including a woman named Giselle Maxine, contacted the household regarding U's work in Palm Beach, with Maxine being described as unpleasant.
El estimates U was traveling to Palm Beach for work for approximately two and a half years during his teenage years.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating sensitive or confidential information.
